update.description: This fixes #219 by checking `//axis/xyz/@expressed_in` before rotating joint axis in the parser's `addNestedModel` function. I've added a test that includes 3 different `double_pendulum_with_base` models, first as a model directly in the world, then then twice as nested models from sdf 1.4 and sdf 1.5. The sdf 1.4 model will have `//axis/xyz/@expressed_in == "__model__"`, so it will retain the rotation behavior, but the model loaded from sdf 1.5 will not be rotated.
update.title: parser addNestedModel: only rotate joint axis xyz if expressed_in == '__model__' (#219)

pull_request.title: parser addNestedModel: only rotate joint axis xyz if expressed_in == '__model__' (#219)

pullrequest.title: parser addNestedModel: only rotate joint axis xyz if expressed_in == '__model__' (#219)

content.raw: I like the idea of failing fast, but I'm a little leery of throwing because it doesn't seem consistent with the rest of the libsdformat's API, i.e, we only throw when there's an unexpected null pointer, not when the sdformat file has a semantic error.
content.html: I like the idea of failing fast, but I'm a little leery of throwing because it doesn't seem consistent with the rest of the libsdformat's API, i.e, we only throw when there's an unexpected null pointer, not when the sdformat file has a semantic error.

content.raw: it's aggressive, but if we throw here, users could still use the overload by passing an `Errors&` if they want to avoid exceptions, so it could be ok. what do you think @azeey?
content.html: it's aggressive, but if we throw here, users could still use the overload by passing an Errors& if they want to avoid exceptions, so it could be ok. what do you think @azeey?

content.raw:
I've added an overload for `addNestedModel` with an `Errors` parameter, added documentation for the `addNestedModel` function, and added unit tests

it returns an error if `expressed_in` is not empty, `__model__`, or equal to `//joint/child`
content.html:
I've added an overload for addNestedModel with an Errors parameter, added documentation for the addNestedModel function, and added unit tests

it returns an error if expressed_in is not empty, __model__, or equal to //joint/child

content.raw:
we can add print an error easily enough, but this function returns `void`, so do we want to:

* add an overload for this function with an `Errors&` output parameter
* throw an exception (I think we don't want to do this)
* just print an error and nothing else

we can add print an error easily enough, but this function returns void, so do we want to:

  • add an overload for this function with an Errors& output parameter
  • throw an exception (I think we don't want to do this)
  • just print an error and nothing else

pullrequest.title: parser addNestedModel: only rotate joint axis xyz if expressed_in == '__model__' (#219)

content.raw:
Per f2f, `//include` and pose frame semantics \(`@expressed_in`, `@relative_to`, and `@attached_to`\) do not work together.

For now, could you make this error out / warn loudly if `@expressed_in` is not empty or `__model__`?
content.html:
Per f2f, //include and pose frame semantics (@expressed_in, @relative_to, and @attached_to) do not work together.

For now, could you make this error out / warn loudly if @expressed_in is not empty or __model__?
